TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
> 
> So we're gonna hear nothing about this ordeal for months until something drastic happens and then we get answers. D:

I don't think I should have to tell a KSP player the geometric difference between "arc" and "two unconnected points" ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> RIP Gemmane Kerman

Look closer at that name, people. Not Kerman.

Fear the **Kermulan** Star Empire

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-27T21:25:47Z" title="10/27/2015 09:25  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 27, 2015</time> by Deddly**
Oooh... mysteries! Is there a rival space program where every kerbonaut has a goatee?

> 
> Interlude part 2 of 3:
> [http://i.imgur.com/WuC062t.png](http://i.imgur.com/WuC062t.png)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/3Zitvtz.png](http://i.imgur.com/3Zitvtz.png)
>

> [http://i.imgur.com/F60uFna.png](http://i.imgur.com/F60uFna.png)
> 
> Now I'm sure you have a lot of questions... none of which I'm going to answer ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) But feel free to speculate wildly, I left you some good clues and I think someone will figure it all out. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Mirror, Mirror, on the wall. Who is the most back-Sward of them all?
OK...who would be crazy enough to send an armed SSTO to orbit just to vaporise one helpless person?
Okay, so we seems to have a Star Trek reference with Kermulans, except they're the ones that need to be rescued!

> 
> Look closer at that name, people. Not Kerman.
> Fear the **Kermulan** Star Empire

HA, nice catch, I didn't see that one.

> 
> OK...who would be crazy enough to send an armed SSTO to orbit just to vaporise one helpless person?

I dunno, the Keringons? Then again, code of honor and stuff.

> 
> [...]
> I dunno, the Keringons? Then again, code of honor and stuff.

In the original series, the Romulans were the more honorable species.

I don't think it'd be above the Klingons to do that.

> 
> OK...who would be crazy enough to send an armed SSTO to orbit just to vaporise one helpless person?

Oh, but this is delicious! I can say this: there is not enough information in those four pages to answer your question definitively, Scotius... but there is more than enough to definitively say who did *not*... and I still don't think anyone has spotted the biggest clue ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Oh, but this is delicious! I can say this: there is not enough information in those four pages to answer your question definitively, Scotius... but there is more than enough to definitively say who did *not*... and I still don't think anyone has spotted the biggest clue ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I feel like it is Mort.... As that would be the opposite to what Kenlie thought...

> 
> Oh, but this is delicious! I can say this: there is not enough information in those four pages to answer your question definitively, Scotius... but there is more than enough to definitively say who did *not*... and I still don't think anyone has spotted the biggest clue ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Would that be the fact that you edited the 90 (or 60?) on the runway to 27?

Or maybe, that wouldn't make sense, as Mort gets funds from rescuing stranded kerbs..... Maybe it's the companies (that we've never heard of before) that the kerbals are ditching for kerbfleet! The companies could be rivals, and they wouldn't want kerbfleet to get those funds.... Maybe they're also spiteful that they are loosing their kerbals..... It wouldn't be Mort though.

I did notice that the interceptor ship took off from runway 27 instead of 09- dunno if that's relevant. I wonder what will happen if whoever's piloting the interceptor figures out that the missing/target Kermulan is no longer aboard the wreck...
Well, page 27 in the thread comes up with nothing....

> 
> Well, page 27 in the thread comes up with nothing....

The problem with that is, which forum setting?

I tried wiki'ng Star Trek TOS episode 27, but that one deals with parallel universes and has nothing to do with the Romulans or otherwise.

> 
> Would that be the fact that you edited the 90 (or 60?) on the runway to 27?

That's different? I didn't notice.

> 
> The problem with that is, which forum setting?
> I tried wiki'ng Star Trek TOS episode 27, but that one deals with parallel universes and has nothing to do with the Romulans or otherwise.

Is it mirror, mirror? That one's about parallel universes where starfleet is a militaristic tyranny.
There's a logo flag on the exploded pod? Can any one ID it?

> 
> There's a logo flag on the exploded pod? Can any one ID it?

Kerlington model rockets

> 
> There's a logo flag on the exploded pod? Can any one ID it?

Kerlington.

You can read all the letters at that resolution? I'm impressed ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> You can read all the letters at that resolution? I'm impressed ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I'm not reading from the comic, and I have a monitor. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> That's different? I didn't notice.
> Is it mirror, mirror? That one's about parallel universes where starfleet is a militaristic tyranny.

No, that's Season 2, episode 4. Season 1, episode 27 (also 27 in the series) is [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Alternative_Factor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Alternative_Factor)

Could that number be interpreted differently, such as season 2, episode 7? Or could it be flipped around to say L2 instead, and mean something completely different?

Also, I have the feeling this is just a story in Kenlie's head, and that the shooting of the helpless kerbal never happened. We get a good hint that the pod the kerbal to be rescued is in is different from the pod the kerbal got blown up in, and Kenlie implying that it is just a story in his head.

Though with the way Kuzzter is addressing this...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-28T01:35:17Z" title="10/28/2015 01:35  AM" data-short="8 yr">October 28, 2015</time> by Noname117**

> 
> Could that number be interpreted differently, such as season 2, episode 7? Or could it be flipped around to say L2 instead, and mean something completely different?

I thought of the season 2, episode 7 thing, no match. I had also thought maybe production code 27, but no match either. Maybe the 27 is a red herring.

to me, the "ugly" SSTO looked like a ship from Star Trek- the one kinda like a bird.
